verses.roman:
śuniyā pasāri saba cāṅgaḍā uṭhāñā
prasāda dite āse tārā ānandita hañā

synonyms: śuniyā—hearing; pasāri—the shopkeepers; saba—all; cāṅgaḍā uṭhāñā—taking a big basket; prasāda dite—to deliver the prasāda; āse—come forward; tāra—they; ānandita hañā—in great jubilation.
translation: Hearing this, all the shopkeepers immediately came forward with big baskets of prasāda, which they jubilantly delivered to Lord Caitanya.
